overview_of_class:
Cylindrical and spherical coordinates, double and triple integrals, line and surface integrals. Change of variables in multiple integrals; gradient, divergence, and curl. Theorems of Green, Gauss, and Stokes. Students may not receive credit for both 234 and 281-1, 285-3, 290-3, or 291-3. Prerequisite: 230.

THIS COURSE HAS MANDATORY EVENING MIDTERM EXAMINATIONS AT 6PM ON APRIL 28 AND MAY 19. PLEASE CHECK THE REGISTRAR'S WEBPAGE FOR DETAILS: http://www.registrar.northwestern.edu/registration/midterms.html

This exam takes precedence over scheduled meetings of other classes, including labs and discussion sections, held at this time, and it is up to the student to make arrangements for handling conflicts arising from such meetings. In special circumstances, arrangements for dealing with other unavoidable conflicts can be made by alerting the course coordinator at least two weeks ahead of time; he/she will decide if your conflict can be accommodated.
name: Multiple Integration and Vector Calculus
subject: MATH
